item.title: NYC Mayor indicted. And, Hurricane Helene expected to be catastrophic

item.title: How Russia’s RT went from a cable news clone to covert operator
item.description: RT was long known to be a source of Russian propaganda. But a recent indictment of two employees for covertly funneling $10 million to pro-Trump influencers shines a light on its covert activities.

item.title: Japanese court acquits a man in a 1966 murder retrial after decades on death row
item.description: A court ruled Thursday that an 88-year-old former boxer was not guilty in a retrial for a 1966 quadruple murder. He spent 48 years behind bars, making him the world's longest-serving death row inmate.

item.title: A History of Hezbollah (Throwback)
item.description:
Hezbollah is a Lebanese paramilitary organization and political party that's directly supported by the Islamic Republic of Iran. In the wake of the October 7, 2023 Hamas-led attack on Israel, and Israel's invasion of Gaza, there have been escalating attacks between Hezbollah and Israel across the border they share.

Today on the show: a history of Hezbollah.

item.title: A zoo in Finland is returning pandas to China because they're too expensive to keep
item.description: The zoo has agreed with Chinese authorities to return two giant pandas to China more than eight years ahead of schedule because they have become too expensive to maintain amid declining visitors.

item.title: What the U.S. Military is Learning from the Drone War in Ukraine
item.description: As the war in Ukraine drags on, the U.S. military is keeping a close eye on how drones are changing the conflict. They are used by both Russia and Ukraine to watch troop movements, identify targets and drop bombs. We go to the woods of Louisiana to see what lessons the U.S. Army is incorporating into its training and understand what it might mean for future wars.
